decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES6, H8, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5, H8, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 5.5, 5.9. | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5, ES6, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 5.5, 5.9.
description: Single storey rear extension to house
